snippet: In a sign of the growing humanitarian crisis in Syrian cities and villages, as many as 2,000 people are believed to be heading for the Lebanese border, a United Nations official said.
abstract: Scores of people fleeing the war in Syria are believed to be headed toward Lebanese border, signaling a growing humanitarian crisis in Syrian cities and villages as the government pursues its opponents on new fronts.

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Paris, and Sebnem Arsu and Hwaida Saad from Antakya.

lead_paragraph: In a sign of the growing humanitarian crisis in Syrian cities and villages, as many as 2,000 people are believed to be heading for the Lebanese border, a United Nations official said.

headline.seo: Influx of Syrian Refugees Headed to Lebanon, U.N. Warns
headline.main: Lebanon Expects Influx of Refugees From Syria
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Expects Influx Of Refugees From Syria
